Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery amphora; exterior: on left, black handle zone; in panel, black-figure decoration consisting of part of horse to right (neck with mane and rein with traces of dots in added white remaining).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For a parallel, see Athens 12713, Cook 1952, plo. 31,1 and Boardman, J., Early Greek Vase Painting. London 1998, 171, fig. 348. Cook suggests that the painter of this vase is the same as the one who painted Oxford AN1896-1908.G.130.8 and AN1912.33a based on the manner in which the manes were depicted.
Bibliographic references: Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 136, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.037) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
